title: New Champ Select: Feedback and Investigation Thread on Queue Times
body:
Hey everyone,

We're going to spend the weekend investigating some queue time issues. We need **your** help! 

IF you have a queue time **over 15 minutes**, and have had NO QUEUE POPS or QUEUE DODGES at all, please post:

1) Time of Day 
2) Queue Time so Far (Screenshot would be best!)
3) Summoner Name (in case it's different than the account you are posting with)
4) Primary/Secondary Positions
5) Rank Tier
6) Premade Friends and their Summoners (if you were premade)

Thank you!

EDIT ::: We believe we found the tuning issue that resulted in longer queue times. If you see queue times above 30 minutes, please keep posting. We'll do a tuning change Monday morning that should dramatically reduce high queue times.

replies.body:
1. Around 12:30 P.M
2. I dodged after 45 minutes, had the queue pop once at 31 minutes. http://imgur.com/7tcCahF
3. Canzieatzyou
4. Jungle/support
5. Diamond 2
6. Soloq

How did they program this to make it wait 45 MINUTES???

WOW. Even when I queued Top, Teambuilder never went over 20 minutes! Granted, 20 minutes isn't *quite* optimal, but it's still less... awful.
I still miss Team Builder. But what does Rank Teir have to do with this? Should I just say Unranked? I don't play Ranked, and am staying out of it this year.

Rank tier means there is certain pool of players you could be matched with. Higher tiers have smaller player pools. You should just say unranked or normals, they can find your phantom elo from their own data.
Unrankeds are considered Silver by default anyway.
Not true. Normals have their own MMR, you just can't see it.
What? They are deemed Silver the moment they hit 30 and their MMR will rise/drop depending on their win ratio.
I've played normals with d2 mmr, but had unranked players in my game. Hidden normal mmr changes it as well.
I said by DEFAULT, it changes when you play games.

Hi Lyte,

I know you've been super busy, but when will you get back to answering on your ask.fm page? Any idea?

Thanks for putting out information on this. I will go play some matches just to check the queue times.

Thanks.
-DTN

lol you got 18 downvotes
who knows why
Existing in the vicinity of Lyte. I got here first, so easy target.
This is a thread for data collection and bugs, not for talking to Lyte. I know that it seems like the only way to get in touch, but that's just not what it's for.
I wasn't arguing that. If it wasn't Lyte and I had posted later, then I wouldn't have downvotes like this.

when you picked your champ, did you remember to LOCK IN that champ? New champ select doesn't auto-lock in

'>.> really? zzzz that so dumb
thanks for the help tho

So, now that i have had a chance to play a few games within this new system I figured it was time to give some feedback.

First off, it looks amazing. I love the new style quite a bit. And I can totally see what you guys are TRYING to do and I appreciate that too. 

But... I hate it. The queue times are long, the pick/ban is long then someone dodges and it starts all over again. Yuck. Not sure what can be done about that honestly, so I suppose its something I will have to get used to.

Furthermore, i have seen a serious incline of trolling. Be it troll picks, feeders or ragers in game. I have had to report more people in the last few days than the last two months combined. Not sure whats causing that but I sure hope it thins out soon. 

But the primary reason I hate it is having to choose two roles. Frankly I dont want to choose two roles. The queue times suck enough already so I would be fine waiting a bit longer to actually get the role I want. Especially since it seems ill be playing with toxic people anyway. I may as well have as much fun and get as much experience at my preferred role as I can. 

I get it, you see team builder as a redundant system and feel its not needed. Ok cool. Then please give us an option to queue for only one role. Or, when the game pops let us see what role it assigned us. That way if we dont feel like playing the secondary role, we dont have to accept and we can reenter the queue.

^
Another thing i hate, you have to LOCK IN, otherwise its  a "dodge". When i pick a bann or a champ, i dont want to have to LOCK IN to get my pick. Sometime when you are last pick, you just want to take the whole timer you have to set my masteries. I just got dodged by myself because i picked malph, but didnt lock in. This is ridiculous.

Its very clear that the supportive comments...are about the look and not the functionality.  The UX team failed hard here.  They changed the sounds.  Increased overall wait time _in_ selection and _out_ of selection.  They achieved none of their goals and made a more miserable experience.  I'm sensing fanboys tested it and said, "wow this ___looks___ great" or they got positive feedback from how HotS does this (where you are not punished as long as you select).

New champ select is great for ranked. Love it. 

But we need team builder back as it just takes too long to get games started when we are just having fun. Queue times seem to have settled down. Its the whole process that is a bit much.  And then you're just about to get the game going and someone forgets to lock in!  Start all over again. 

I'm in champ select right now building a team with the same random players banning and choosing  the same champs for the 3rd time in a row... 

Sorry, but the level of detail goes against the value of playing normals. 

Love the new champ select, but it takes to long to have fun in normals.

And what about the contrary?
CONSTANT popup and CONSTANT queues but no game start?

Brain dead long potential wait time,
Brain dead long actual wait time,
Brain dead high number of dodgers.

Might want to look into this, before trying to fix a problem that's a CONSEQUENCE of the above.

1) 11:05

I am tired on waiting in Queues that take anywhere from 3-10 minutes just to have a player not lockin their champ and have to start over again.  I just had it happen 9 times before I gave up.  Why not make it so the champ that is declared before bans is autolocked if the player doesn't lock it manually?  This would speed up the time it takes to get into a game for a lot of players.

1) 5pm today, last night about 2am

2) Today: http://i.imgur.com/Nj6R2Ji.jpg?1 (40 minutes) Yesterday: http://i.imgur.com/2eqr0N3.jpg?1 (2 hours)

3) Amara 

4) Mid/Fill

5) lvl 28

6) Solo Draft Normal

Today there was 1 dodge after 30 minutes, yesterday there were several dodges, but only every 30-40 minutes. For two fucking hours.

I get the opposite when I choose "Bot" as my secondary I get thrown into a game instantly as ADC which is my secondary. I can't get my primary (support) unless I choose a more popular role... e.g. Mid/Top as secondary.
As much as I like ADC, I'd rather wait a few minutes instead of being forced to play a role I don't enjoy very much.

I feel like people should be able to refuse a "secondary" pick. It would increase their que times yea, but it will help people get the role they want even more, and prevent people from changing after the team is in champion select.

New Champ Select sucks

I am so fucking used to selecting my champ and letting the timer run out, and it locking in that it is damn near impossible for me to play now. I have 4 dodges, because of failure to lock in. Why the heck did you change this. It is so horrible.

There are plenty of feedback checks, I Queue, I click the checkmark to join, I pick my champ beforehand, I ban a champ, I select a champ, Why do you need me to lock in the selection, why not just auto pick the champ I have selected when time runs out?
Will just play DOTA, queues are never 15 minutes.

This thing fricking sucks.... its not the matter of the Que times.. its the matter of, "oh i looked away for like 30 seconds" and got kicked from the game... I was litterally went to change my music, looked back, selected my champ... and still got kicked cause i didn't pick "Lock in"  its stupid. And its a huge pain in the Heimerdonger.... Fix that. The rest of it is fine. except if you Secondary Support.. Then you get nothing but support, that sorta blows. Just saying... Im not a High Elo Player or anything, and this maybe a personal problem but... Oh and also if you get kicked, and you have to wait 5 minutes, sometimes after you pick "Play" and "Launch" instead of showing you the Timer it will just go back to the main screen. Then I cant use the "X" at the top right to close it.. or even right click close it from the bottom... i literally have to open task manager and shut it down. So now its like "yeah i kicked you, and you cant see how long, and you cant close me down? You tilted yet?" Like common.
Happens to me all the time, enormously long waits when the estimated time is 2 minutes.
Bring back the old system.  Flawed as it was, at least you didn't have to wait for queues...I can instant pop now if I pick fill...which always makes me support.  Fail system Riot.

Hi
Around 11:30PM UTC last night (26/1/15) I was stuck in queue for around 30 minutes, one dodge around 5 mins in.
I was Primary Support, secondary Bot
I'm unranked and fairly new, level 19, not sure if that has anything to do with it.
Not premade.

Would love for this to get sorted as I have been looking forward to NCS for a while. Thanks

One hour all up Queue length, and I have yet to see a pop up, Even re-entering the Queue twice, changing preferences to just fill, and still nothing.

Interface looks great; I dislike the need to auto lock, but that's due to other players not knowing that you're meant to more or less.
I have an idea bring back team builder WTF!

Can the game just lock our champion in at the end of our pick period? Why was this change made in the first place?

Also declaring your champ is useless because the enemy team can see it before you lock in.
